TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ValidatedControlConverter extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.ControlIDConverter

Docs.summary: Converts a control on the Web Forms page that can be validated with a validation control to a string containing the control's ID.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool FilterControl(class System.Web.UI.Control control) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the specified control should be added to the list of controls that can be validated.
Docs.returns: if the control should be added to the list of controls that can be validated; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidatedControlConverter.FilterControl%2A> method returns `true`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ValidatedControlConverter> instance will add the ID of the control specified in the control parameter to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> returned by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ControlIDConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method.

Docs.param: An that provides a format context that can be used to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked. This parameter or properties of this parameter can be .
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of standard values for the data type this type converter is designed for when provided with a format context.
Docs.returns: A collection that holds a standard set of valid values, or if the data type does not support a standard set of values.

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the collection of standard values returned from is an exclusive list of possible values, using the specified context.
